thread.title: Diebold in talks to buy German ATM maker Wincor for $1.7 billion - MarketWatch
thread.title_full: Diebold in talks to buy German ATM maker Wincor for $1.7 billion - MarketWatch

author: Eyk Henning
title: Diebold in talks to buy German ATM maker Wincor for $1.7 billion - MarketWatch
text:
U.S. automated teller machine maker Diebold Inc. DBD, +1.98% is in talks to buy Wincor Nixdorf AG in a deal that would value the German company at more than $1.7 billion, Wincor said Saturday.
The companies entered into a nonbinding agreement on the key parameters of a cash-and-share deal valuing Wincor at â‚¬52.50 a share on Sept. 24, the German company said.
The talks come as the ATM- and checkout machine-making industry is shifting toward software-based solutions, which are costly to develop, amid declining prices for the traditional hardware business.
Such a transaction is still subject to material conditions and analyses, in particular the completion of mutual due diligences, Wincor said.
